section.title: Quickstart Installation Guides
section.para: These quickstart guides will provide you with simple instructions on how to install &name-icinga; from source and have it monitoring your local machine within 20 minutes. Advanced installation options and configuration are discussed elsewhere.
Links to configuration tools and other addons can be found here.

Besides, a new quick install guide for using the &name-idoutils; of &name-icinga; is also available enabling you to use an RDBMS based on &name-mysql;, &name-oracle;, or &name-postgres;, respectively.

Quickstart installation guides are currently available for various Linux distributions (most common &name-fedora;, &name-ubuntu;, &name-opensuse;). Because some distributions are similar you may succeed to use these instructions for &name-redhat;, &name-centos;, &name-debian; and &name-sles; as well. Marcel Hecko provided a quickstart quide for &name-freebsd;.
If you are installing &name-icinga; on an operating system or Linux distribution that isn't listed above, read for an overview of what you'll need to do.
Command names, paths, etc. vary widely across different Operating Systems/Distributions, so you'll likely need to tweak the installation docs a bit to work for your particular case.
